item.title: Report X-2024110141
item.description:
Report X-2024110141

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-07T12:22:36+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-25
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AN UNLOAD SUPERVISOR APPROACHED THE DESIGNATED RESPONDER AND NOTIFIED HIM OF A LEAKING HAZMAT IN DOOR 35 AT APPROXIMATELY 16:20. THE RESPONDER DONNING FULL PPE ARRIVED ON SCENE WITH HIS DECISION TREE AND FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. AFTER REFERRING TO THE DECISION TREE AND ACTING ACCORDINGLY THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP CAGE FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2024110041
item.description:
Report E-2024110041

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-07T12:22:36+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-03
  • City: MARSHFIELD
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 10:50 AM ET, XSJ contacted ERTS to notify of a spill that was found inside of a trailer in Marshfield, MO. The spill consists of approximately 5 or more gallons of Flurospar White, which released from (1) 275-gallon metal tote due to a missing lid, causing the tote to slosh and splash during transit. The paint is all over the top of the tote and has spread out to the sides and the floor of the trailer as well. Contractors confirmed 1-gallon of material had been released and transferred into a 330-gallon plastic tote. The old tote was cleaned and wiped down, released material was cleaned up on the trailer floor and walls and the waste material, impacted granular absorbents, pads, PPE, plastic and PVC tube were placed into (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged on site for terminal to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024110099
item.description:
Report X-2024110099

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-06T12:32:05+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-23
  • City: CAMDENTON
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO AN AIR PACKAGE FOR CONTENT INSPECTION DUE TO THE RATTLE SOUND OF AN AEROSOL CAN. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED A 13.2 OUNCE AEROSOL CAN OF EXTREMELY FLAMMABLE LAC R'SHOT! GUN LIKE LACQUER SPRAY. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
